name: Do You Know Movies? Online Trivia | Movies Grab Bag | 15 Questions

questions.text: The third "Star Wars" movie to be made was "Return of the Jedi". "Return of the Jedi" came out in 1983, but before it was released it had a different title. What was this discarded title?
questions.explanation:
Revenge of the Jedi.

	"Star Wars VI: Return of the Jedi" was originally going to be "Revenge of the Jedi". The title was changed before the movie hit theatres because Jedi are not the vengeful type.

questions.text: In the movie "13 Going on 30", Jenna and Matt have a special way of saying good-bye to each other. What two languages do they use to say good-bye?
questions.explanation:
Italian, French.

	You see this for the first time in the beginning of the movie when Jenna and Matt walk home together to their houses. They live next door to each other.

questions.text: In "Scary Movie 3" you do NOT see spoofs of which of these movies?
questions.explanation:
School of Rock.

	Examples of spoofs are... The rapping contest.("8 Mile") The girl with hair in her face that kills people.("The Ring") The aliens.("Signs") Despite the name, "Scary Movie 3" isn't scary.

questions.text: In "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade" Indiana dresses up as a person who takes tickets on a zeppelin in order to avoid the Nazis. After he throws one of the Nazis chasing his father and him out the window of the zeppelin, what does he say to the passengers?
questions.explanation:
"No ticket."

	After he says that everyone else on the zeppelin get out their tickets and wave them frantically.

questions.text: In "The Village" there is a bad color and a good color. The bad color is red. What is the good color?
questions.explanation:
yellow.

	Anyone who travels in the woods must wear the good color to try to protect themselves and must travel in the woods only if necessary. The bad color must never be seen.

questions.text: In "School of Rock" Dewey Finn poses as Mr. Schneebly, a substitute teacher. He has the kids in his class say a pledge in the movie. Finish this quote. "I pledge allegiance to the ______."
questions.explanation:
band.

	This is when he first starts the band. "I pledge allegiance ... to the band ... of Mr. Schneebly... and will not fight him ... for creative control ... and will defer to him on all issues related to the musical direction of the band."

questions.text: In the "Sixth Sense" Cole likes to play with his knights. In the beginning when Cole is playing with his knights in a church what language is he speaking?
questions.explanation:
Latin.

	Cole also wears glasses with no lenses. In my opinion Haley Joel Osment makes a good performance in this movie.

questions.text: In "The Ring" Samara is pushed down a well by her mother. Rachel ends up in that same well. Where is this well located?
questions.explanation:
Under Cabin 12.

	Cabin 12 is part of Shelter Mountain. Rachel's niece, Katie, and three other friends stayed at Cabin 12 for a weekend. That is where they all saw the tape that kills people. Rachel also saw the tape there.

questions.text: Helen Hunt played Lynne in "Girls Just Want to Have Fun". She also played Jo and starred with Bill Paxton in which movie?
questions.explanation:
Twister.

	Paxton plays Bill Harding. Bill and Jo are both researchers who chase tornadoes and are married. Bill wants to get a divorce and take a new job as a weatherman in the beginning of the movie. Over the course of events in this movie Bill realizes what he would be missing if he changed his life. Bill and Jo stay married, Bill keeps his job, and they all lived happily ever after chasing twisters.

questions.text: Rachel Hurd-Wood played Wendy in the 2003 version of "Peter Pan". Who played Peter?
questions.explanation:
Jeremy Sumpter.

	Jeremy Sumpter was also in a 2004 television series called "Clubhouse" and played Pete, a batboy for a major-league baseball team. Sadly, "Clubhouse" was cancelled.

questions.text: Which of these "Pirates of the Caribbean: the Curse of the Black Pearl" stars was also one of the main characters in the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy?
questions.explanation:
Orlando Bloom.

	Orlando Bloom played Legolas Greenleaf, the archer. Bloom went from playing an Elf with very long blond hair who was a good archer to an English man in the Caribbean with shorter brown hair who was good with a sword.

questions.text: In the 1987 movie "The Princess Bride", who has been "mostly-dead all day"?
questions.explanation:
Westley.

	"It just so happens that your friend here is only MOSTLY dead. There's a big difference between mostly dead and all dead. Mostly dead is slightly alive." It turns out that there is a big difference.

questions.text: This question is from the movie "Looney Tunes: Back in Action". When Bugs Bunny is fighting Marvin the Martian in space, he pulls out a book to read. This book is called "The ______ for Dummies".
questions.explanation:
Force.

	This is one of the many movie spoofs. There is another "Star Wars" spoof in the jungle when Mr. Chairman finds the Blue Monkey and tries to trick DJ into thinking that he is his father.

questions.text: What city is "The Grudge" set in?
questions.explanation:
Tokyo.

	"The Grudge" was originally a Japanese movie called "Ju-on", like "The Ring" was also originally a Japanese movie.

questions.text: What country does "The Sound of Music" take place in?
questions.explanation:
Austria.

	The Von Trapp family is being tracked down by the Nazis because Captain Von Trapp refuses to join the Third Reich and accept Nazi rule over Austria. They climb the Alps into Switzerland for safety.
